video_description:
http://www.techbargains.com/reviews/265280 -- Check out the written review here.

Here's our review of the 32GB Motorola Xoom from Verizon Wireless. Specs include a dual core Tegra 2 processor running at 1GHz, Android 3.1, 1GB of RAM, 5 megapixel rear facing camera and 2 megapixel front facing camera, Verizon 3G wireless connectivity and a 10.1 inch screen.

Check out http://www.techbargains.com/ for deals and info on the latest technology gadgets.
title: Motorola Xoom Video Review (HD)

comments.text: Hmmm awesome review but﻿ could the aquarium background be using too much ram?
comments.author: gmr4lfe

comments.text:
It's entirely possible, which is somewhat surprising given that it and other animated backgrounds are included on the system, automatically slowing it down.  The processor should easily be able to handle the background, even without apps running,﻿ but it couldn't.

Jeff

comments.text:
Yep, catching basketball highlights of NBA stars; glad that you caught your school in our review, and that you liked the video! Keep coming back for more vids in the near future!

Also, make sure that you﻿ check out our home page, sign up for our newsletter and email alerts for other deals and info, and sign up for our RSS feed!

comments.author: TechBargains

comments.text: on motorola﻿ xoom can you watch normal youtube vids. or only videos uploaded by other tablets or phones? someone please reply.
comments.author: MrIdonenothingwrong

comments.text:
It isnt the Xoom's fault that an App doesnt work. Its the developers. Hence why they are always updating them for better optimization.

And How can you expect perfect streaming on any device.. its always searching for stronger signals even on same network (3g/wifi) so to think you can match﻿ sitting in front of your flatscreen is quite stupid.
comments.author: SalonEdge3526

comments.text: One thing that sets the iPad apart from other tablets is that it just works. Androids give﻿ you more functionality, but often apps don't work right.
comments.author: zach99998

comments.text: Thanks for this﻿ video.... it was the clincher in me deciding on the Xoom as compared to the Galaxy Tab and Ipad...i ordered it today and can't wait to xoom xoom xoom anda boom boom...lol lame i know...
comments.author: snarnold1

comments.text: I hear ya﻿ but i'll give up a few crappy apps for flash ANYDAY....
comments.author: snarnold1

comments.text: works on all youtube i do believe...and it has flash so you can watch stuff on say justintv,﻿ side reel, and tvlinks That for me was the BIG selling point     Ordered mine today.....
comments.author: snarnold1

comments.text:
Ever since live backgrounds first came out, they make all android phones they run on slow down just the tiniest bit at times.
Its not the end of the world, but its taking up CPU time to render and will reduce performance and battery life.
This applies to all android phones and tablets.

Despite this, the Xoom and Iconia and Transformer tablets are wonderful kick butt tablets. I would rather﻿ have one  than 
any product from Cupertino.

comments.text: Android/Zoom﻿ falls somewhere in the middle.  Between Apple IOS which has the most apps but the worst OS and BB Playbook which has the best OS/user interface but the fewest apps.
